burlap.oomdp.singleagent.environment

Interface TaskSettableEnvironment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Environment
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimulatedEnvironment, SimulatedPOEnvironment

    public interface TaskSettableEnvironment
extends Environment
    And Environment interface extension that allows the RewardFunction and TerminalFunction to set and accessed.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RewardFunction getRf()
      Returns the RewardFunction this Environment uses to determine rewards.
      TerminalFunction getTf()
      Returns the TerminalFunction this Environment uses to determine terminal states
      void setRf(RewardFunction rf)
      Sets the RewardFunction of this Environment to the specified reward function.
      void setTf(TerminalFunction tf)
      Sets the TerminalFunction of this Environment to the specified terminal function.

      • Methods inherited from interface burlap.oomdp.singleagent.environment.Environment

        executeAction, getCurrentObservation, getLastReward, isInTerminalState, resetEnvironment

    • Method Detail

      • setRf

        void setRf(RewardFunction rf)
        Sets the RewardFunction of this Environment to the specified reward function.
        Parameters:
        rf - the new RewardFunction of the Environment.

      • setTf

        void setTf(TerminalFunction tf)
        Sets the TerminalFunction of this Environment to the specified terminal function.
        Parameters:
        tf - the new TerminalFunction of the Environment.
